title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง 1.5 - Requests and appeals
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง 1.5 - Requests and appeals

State Regulations
(a) Requests
for records. A request, oral or written, to view or be provided copies of
department records should be sufficiently detailed to identify the requested
records to enable agency personnel to locate them within reasonable limits of
time and effort. Where possible, the requestor should supply specific
information regarding dates, titles, file designations, or other information
which may help identify the record. (b) Appeals. A party whose request for a
record or records of the department is denied in whole or in part may appeal
such denial, in writing to: Commissioner of Transportation

Attn: Executive Assistant

New York State Department of Transportation

State Office Campus
1220 Washington Avenue

Albany, NY 12232

Telephone (518) 457-2345

The written appeal shall contain: (1)
the date and location of the request for
records; (2)
a copy of the written
request for records, or if it is made orally, a listing of the records
requested and to whom; and
(3)
a
copy of the letter of denial. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง
1.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
